column3: @sipsorcery want to take a look here & confirm the fix for windows?
Hmm Windows should typically be able to deal with `/` paths. Maybe it's a Python on Windows problem. I'll verify.
Jup, I don't think this is a bug fix. We've been running the functional tests on windows just fine.

FWIW, In the future if we really want to be have the slashes agnostic, we can use `pathlib.Path` which overrides the Div operator to insert slashes so you could do: `Path(some_path) / 'src' / 'bitcoind'`.\n\nhttps://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html
I like using `os.path.join` here (it's consistentâ€”what we use in other places too). But yes, please change the motivation if it's a refactor not a fix.\n

I can verify that the current `test_framework.py` on `master` doesn't have any path issues when run on Windows.

It's hard to see where it could ever become a problem since modern day Windows accepts `/` as an alternative path separator.

The command below works fine on my Windows 10 machine:

`cd c:/dev\github/sipsorcery_bitcoin//build_msvc`

I import the test suite code in another project to automate regtest testing: when looking for the bitcoind binary on a Windows 10 machine, Python 3.8.2, no WSL, the original code fails.\nAlso, just two lines below the code is using os.path.join, so consistency is lacking
